column4: this setup isn't that complex.. it's just a win 3.11 VM on the same network as everythign else in my house
except this VM heh
and I'm sure it's just the ancientness of WIn 3.11
but i thought I'd ask anyway
my life is pretty boring :)
Win 3.11 doesn't come with TCP/IP support, so all bets are off
I have TCPIP for WFW installed
masochist, take your sick deviant behaviour out of here
lol :p
now, I must get back to porting Fig-Forth to a 1980s synthesizer...
I don't suppose I should tell you about my Tandy 1000 VM running Deskmate
#ubuntu-offtopic, or possibly #classiccmp ;-)
okay okay I'll shut up now
I'll leave you with this thought: http://gordonjcp.github.com/miragetools/
that's pretty kickass
it's fun poking the sound chip directly
Forth is a fun language
I poke chips all the time (I'm an EE)
I don't get to do it nearly as much as I'd like to, but I spend a lot of time repairing stuff

It can get tiresome especially when you're debugging stuff... so why my whole 311 project is about is establishing a link between two 19.2k v.32 modems using the 6kHz audio channel in a 2-meter FM Ham Radio instead of the copper phone lines, to successfully dial into a BBS
#ubuntu-offtopic, this sounds like fun
